017package org.apache.juneau.commons.collections;
018
019import static org.apache.juneau.commons.utils.AssertionUtils.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.commons.utils.ThrowableUtils.*;
021import static org.apache.juneau.commons.utils.Utils.*;
022
023import java.util.*;
024import java.util.function.*;
025
026/**
027 * A set wrapper that filters elements based on a {@link Predicate} when they are added.
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * This class wraps an underlying set and applies a filter to determine whether elements should be added.
031 * Only elements that pass the filter (i.e., the predicate returns <jk>true</jk>) are actually stored in
032 * the underlying set.
033 *
034 * <h5 class='section'>Features:</h5>
035 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
036 *    <li><b>Flexible Filtering:</b> Use any {@link Predicate} to filter elements based on any criteria
037 *    <li><b>Optional Filter:</b> Filter is optional when using the builder - defaults to accepting all elements
038 *    <li><b>Multiple Filters:</b> Can combine multiple filters using AND logic
039 *    <li><b>Custom Set Types:</b> Works with any set implementation via the builder's <c>inner</c> method
040 *    <li><b>Type Conversion:</b> Supports automatic type conversion via element function
041 *    <li><b>Convenience Methods:</b> Provides {@link #add(Object)}, {@link #addAll(Collection)}, and {@link #addAny(Object...)} for easy element addition
042 *    <li><b>Transparent Interface:</b> Implements the full {@link Set} interface, so it can be used anywhere a set is expected
043 *    <li><b>Filter on Add:</b> Filtering happens when elements are added via {@link #add(Object)}, {@link #addAll(Collection)}, etc.
044 *    <li><b>Automatic Deduplication:</b> Duplicate elements are automatically handled by the underlying set
045 * </ul>
046 *
047 * <h5 class='section'>Usage:</h5>
048 * <p class='bjava'>
049 *    <jc>// Create a filtered set that only accepts non-null values</jc>
050 *    FilteredSet&lt;String&gt; <jv>set</jv> = FilteredSet
051 *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>)
052 *       .filter(v -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk>)
053 *       .build();
054 *
055 *    <jv>set</jv>.add(<js>"value1"</js>);  <jc>// Added</jc>
056 *    <jv>set</jv>.add(<jk>null</jk>);      <jc>// Filtered out</jc>
057 *    <jv>set</jv>.add(<js>"value3"</js>);  <jc>// Added</jc>
058 *
059 *    <jc>// set now contains: ["value1", "value3"]</jc>
060 * </p>
061 *
062 * <h5 class='section'>Example - Custom Set Type:</h5>
063 * <p class='bjava'>
064 *    <jc>// Create a filtered TreeSet that only accepts positive numbers</jc>
065 *    FilteredSet&lt;Integer&gt; <jv>set</jv> = FilteredSet
066 *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
067 *       .filter(v -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
068 *       .inner(<jk>new</jk> TreeSet&lt;&gt;())
069 *       .build();
070 *
071 *    <jv>set</jv>.add(5);   <jc>// Added</jc>
072 *    <jv>set</jv>.add(-1);  <jc>// Filtered out</jc>
073 *    <jv>set</jv>.add(10);  <jc>// Added</jc>
074 * </p>
075 *
076 * <h5 class='section'>Behavior Notes:</h5>
077 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
078 *    <li>Filtering is applied to all element addition methods: {@link #add(Object)}, {@link #addAll(Collection)}, etc.
079 *    <li>If the filter returns <jk>false</jk>, the element is silently ignored (not added)
080 *    <li>When {@link #add(Object)} filters out an element, it returns <jk>false</jk> (element was not added)
081 *    <li>The filter is not applied when reading from the set (e.g., {@link #contains(Object)})
082 *    <li>All other set operations behave as expected on the underlying set
083 *    <li>The underlying set type is determined by the <c>inner</c> method (defaults to {@link LinkedHashSet})
084 *    <li>Duplicate elements are automatically handled by the underlying set (only one occurrence is stored)
085 * </ul>
086 *
087 * <h5 class='section'>Thread Safety:</h5>
088 * <p>
089 * This class is not thread-safe unless the underlying set is thread-safe. If thread safety is required,
090 * use a thread-safe set type (e.g., {@link java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArraySet}) via the <c>inner</c> method.
091 *
092 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5>
093 * <ul>
094 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../index.html#juneau-commons">Overview &gt; juneau-commons</a>
095 * </ul>
096 *
097 * @param <E> The element type.
098 */
099public class FilteredSet<E> extends AbstractSet<E> {
100
101   /**
102    * Builder for creating {@link FilteredSet} instances.
103    *
104    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
105    * <p class='bjava'>
106    *    FilteredSet&lt;Integer&gt; <jv>set</jv> = FilteredSet
107    *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
108    *       .filter(v -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
109    *       .inner(<jk>new</jk> TreeSet&lt;&gt;())
110    *       .build();
111    * </p>
112    *
113    * @param <E> The element type.
114    */
115   public static class Builder<E> {
116      private Predicate<E> filter = v -> true;
117      private Set<E> inner;
118      private Class<E> elementType;
119      private Function<Object,E> elementFunction;
120
121      /**
122       * Sets the filter predicate that determines whether elements should be added.
123       *
124       * <p>
125       * The predicate receives the element value. If it returns <jk>true</jk>,
126       * the element is added to the set. If it returns <jk>false</jk>, the element is silently ignored.
127       *
128       * <p>
129       * This method is optional. If not called, the set will accept all elements (defaults to <c>v -&gt; true</c>).
130       *
131       * <p>
132       * This method can be called multiple times. When called multiple times, all filters are combined
133       * using AND logic - an element must pass all filters to be added to the set.
134       *
135       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
136       * <p class='bjava'>
137       *    <jc>// Filter out null values</jc>
138       *    Builder&lt;String&gt; <jv>b</jv> = FilteredSet.<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>)
139       *       .filter(v -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk>);
140       *
141       *    <jc>// Filter based on value</jc>
142       *    Builder&lt;Integer&gt; <jv>b2</jv> = FilteredSet.<jsm>create</jsm>(Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
143       *       .filter(v -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0);
144       *
145       *    <jc>// Multiple filters combined with AND</jc>
146       *    Builder&lt;Integer&gt; <jv>b3</jv> = FilteredSet.<jsm>create</jsm>(Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
147       *       .filter(v -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk>)           <jc>// First filter</jc>
148       *       .filter(v -&gt; v &gt; 0)                    <jc>// Second filter (ANDed with first)</jc>
149       *       .filter(v -&gt; v &lt; 100);                  <jc>// Third filter (ANDed with previous)</jc>
150       * </p>
151       *
152       * @param value The filter predicate. Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
153       * @return This object for method chaining.
154       */
155      public Builder<E> filter(Predicate<E> value) {
156         Predicate<E> newFilter = assertArgNotNull("value", value);
157         if (filter == null)
158            filter = newFilter;
159         else
160            filter = filter.and(newFilter);
161         return this;
162      }
163
164      /**
165       * Sets the underlying set instance that will store the filtered elements.
166       *
167       * <p>
168       * If not specified, a new {@link LinkedHashSet} will be created during {@link #build()}.
169       *
170       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
171       * <p class='bjava'>
172       *    <jc>// Use a TreeSet for sorted order</jc>
173       *    Builder&lt;String&gt; <jv>b</jv> = FilteredSet.<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>)
174       *       .inner(<jk>new</jk> TreeSet&lt;&gt;());
175       *
176       *    <jc>// Use a CopyOnWriteArraySet for thread safety</jc>
177       *    Builder&lt;String&gt; <jv>b2</jv> = FilteredSet.<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>)
178       *       .inner(<jk>new</jk> CopyOnWriteArraySet&lt;&gt;());
179       *
180       *    <jc>// Use an existing set</jc>
181       *    Set&lt;String&gt; <jv>existing</jv> = <jk>new</jk> LinkedHashSet&lt;&gt;();
182       *    Builder&lt;String&gt; <jv>b3</jv> = FilteredSet.<jsm>create</jsm>(String.<jk>class</jk>)
183       *       .inner(<jv>existing</jv>);
184       * </p>
185       *
186       * @param value The underlying set instance. Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
187       * @return This object for method chaining.
188       */
189      public Builder<E> inner(Set<E> value) {
190         inner = assertArgNotNull("value", value);
191         return this;
192      }
193
194      /**
195       * Sets the function to use for converting elements when using {@link FilteredSet#add(Object)}.
196       *
197       * <p>
198       * If specified, elements passed to {@link FilteredSet#add(Object)} will be converted using
199       * this function before being added to the set. If not specified, elements must already be of the
200       * correct type (or <c>Object.class</c> is used if types were not specified, which accepts any type).
201       *
202       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
203       * <p class='bjava'>
204       *    FilteredSet&lt;Integer&gt; <jv>set</jv> = FilteredSet
205       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
206       *       .filter(v -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
207       *       .elementFunction(o -&gt; Integer.parseInt(o.toString()))
208       *       .build();
209       *
210       *    <jv>set</jv>.add(<js>"123"</js>);  <jc>// Element will be converted from String to Integer</jc>
211       * </p>
212       *
213       * @param value The element conversion function. Can be <jk>null</jk>.
214       * @return This object for method chaining.
215       */
216      public Builder<E> elementFunction(Function<Object,E> value) {
217         elementFunction = value;
218         return this;
219      }
220
221      /**
222       * Builds a new {@link FilteredSet} instance.
223       *
224       * <p>
225       * If {@link #filter(Predicate)} was not called, the set will accept all elements
226       * (defaults to <c>v -&gt; true</c>).
227       *
228       * @return A new filtered set instance.
229       */
230      public FilteredSet<E> build() {
231         Set<E> set = inner != null ? inner : new LinkedHashSet<>();
232         return new FilteredSet<>(filter, set, elementType, elementFunction);
233      }
234   }
235
236   /**
237    * Creates a new builder for constructing a filtered set.
238    *
239    * @param <E> The element type.
240    * @param elementType The element type class. Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
241    * @return A new builder.
242    */
243   public static <E> Builder<E> create(Class<E> elementType) {
244      assertArgNotNull("elementType", elementType);
245      var builder = new Builder<E>();
246      builder.elementType = elementType;
247      return builder;
248   }
249
250   /**
251    * Creates a new builder for constructing a filtered set with generic types.
252    *
253    * <p>
254    * This is a convenience method that creates a builder without requiring explicit type class parameters.
255    * The generic types must be explicitly specified using the diamond operator syntax.
256    *
257    * <p>
258    * When using this method, type checking is effectively disabled (using <c>Object.class</c> as the type),
259    * allowing any element types to be added. However, the generic type parameter should still be
260    * specified for type safety.
261    *
262    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
263    * <p class='bjava'>
264    *    <jc>// Explicitly specify generic types using diamond operator</jc>
265    *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>set</jv> = FilteredSet
266    *       .&lt;String&gt;<jsm>create</jsm>()
267    *       .filter(<jv>v</jv> -&gt; <jv>v</jv> != <jk>null</jk>)
268    *       .build();
269    * </p>
270    *
271    * @param <E> The element type.
272    * @return A new builder.
273    */
274   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
275   public static <E> Builder<E> create() {
276      var builder = new Builder<E>();
277      builder.elementType = (Class<E>)Object.class;
278      return builder;
279   }
280   private final Predicate<E> filter;
281   private final Set<E> set;
282   private final Class<E> elementType;
283   private final Function<Object,E> elementFunction;
284
285   /**
286    * Constructor.
287    *
288    * @param filter The filter predicate. Can be <jk>null</jk> (if null, all elements are accepted).
289    * @param set The underlying set. Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
290    * @param elementType The element type. Must not be <jk>null</jk> (use <c>Object.class</c> to disable type checking).
291    * @param elementFunction The element conversion function, or <jk>null</jk> if not specified.
292    */
293   protected FilteredSet(Predicate<E> filter, Set<E> set, Class<E> elementType, Function<Object,E> elementFunction) {
294      this.filter = assertArgNotNull("filter", filter);
295      this.set = assertArgNotNull("set", set);
296      this.elementType = assertArgNotNull("elementType", elementType);
297      this.elementFunction = elementFunction;
298   }
299
300   /**
301    * Adds the specified element to this set, if it passes the filter.
302    *
303    * <p>
304    * If the element passes the filter, it is added to the set and this method returns <jk>true</jk>
305    * (or <jk>false</jk> if the element was already present in the set).
306    *
307    * <p>
308    * If the element is filtered out, it is not added to the set and this method returns <jk>false</jk>.
309    *
310    * @param e The element to be added to this set.
311    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the element was added, <jk>false</jk> if it was filtered out or already present.
312    */
313   @Override
314   public boolean add(E e) {
315      if (filter.test(e))
316         return set.add(e);
317      return false;
318   }
319
320   @Override
321   public boolean addAll(Collection<? extends E> c) {
322      boolean modified = false;
323      for (var e : c) {
324         if (filter.test(e)) {
325            if (set.add(e))
326               modified = true;
327         }
328      }
329      return modified;
330   }
331
332   /**
333    * Tests whether the specified element would pass the filter and be added to this set.
334    *
335    * <p>
336    * This method can be used to check if an element would be accepted by the filter without actually
337    * adding it to the set. This is useful for validation, debugging, or pre-checking elements before
338    * attempting to add them.
339    *
340    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
341    * <p class='bjava'>
342    *    FilteredSet&lt;Integer&gt; <jv>set</jv> = FilteredSet
343    *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
344    *       .filter(v -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
345    *       .build();
346    *
347    *    <jk>if</jk> (<jv>set</jv>.wouldAccept(5)) {
348    *       <jv>set</jv>.add(5);  <jc>// Will be added</jc>
349    *    }
350    * </p>
351    *
352    * @param element The element to test.
353    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the element would be added to the set, <jk>false</jk> if it would be filtered out.
354    */
355   public boolean wouldAccept(E element) {
356      return filter.test(element);
357   }
358
359   /**
360    * Returns the filter predicate used by this set.
361    *
362    * <p>
363    * This method provides access to the filter for debugging, inspection, or advanced use cases.
364    * The returned predicate is the combined filter used internally by this set. If multiple filters
365    * were set via the builder, they are combined using AND logic.
366    *
367    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
368    * <p class='bjava'>
369    *    FilteredSet&lt;Integer&gt; <jv>set</jv> = FilteredSet
370    *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
371    *       .filter(v -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
372    *       .build();
373    *
374    *    Predicate&lt;Integer&gt; <jv>filter</jv> = <jv>set</jv>.getFilter();
375    *    <jc>// Use filter for other purposes</jc>
376    * </p>
377    *
378    * @return The filter predicate. Never <jk>null</jk>.
379    */
380   public Predicate<E> getFilter() {
381      return filter;
382   }
383
384   @Override
385   public Iterator<E> iterator() {
386      return set.iterator();
387   }
388
389   @Override
390   public int size() {
391      return set.size();
392   }
393
394   @Override
395   public boolean isEmpty() {
396      return set.isEmpty();
397   }
398
399   @Override
400   public boolean contains(Object o) {
401      return set.contains(o);
402   }
403
404   @Override
405   public boolean containsAll(Collection<?> c) {
406      return set.containsAll(c);
407   }
408
409   @Override
410   public boolean remove(Object o) {
411      return set.remove(o);
412   }
413
414   @Override
415   public boolean removeAll(Collection<?> c) {
416      return set.removeAll(c);
417   }
418
419   @Override
420   public boolean retainAll(Collection<?> c) {
421      return set.retainAll(c);
422   }
423
424   @Override
425   public void clear() {
426      set.clear();
427   }
428
429   @Override
430   public Object[] toArray() {
431      return set.toArray();
432   }
433
434   @Override
435   public <T> T[] toArray(T[] a) {
436      return set.toArray(a);
437   }
438
439   /**
440    * Adds an element to this set with automatic type conversion.
441    *
442    * <p>
443    * This method converts the element using the configured element function (if any) and validates
444    * the type (if element type was specified when creating the set). After conversion and validation,
445    * the element is added using the standard {@link #add(Object)} method, which applies the filter.
446    *
447    * <h5 class='section'>Type Conversion:</h5>
448    * <ul>
449    *    <li>If an element function is configured, the element is converted by applying the function
450    *    <li>If no function is configured, the object is used as-is (but may be validated if types were specified)
451    * </ul>
452    *
453    * <h5 class='section'>Type Validation:</h5>
454    * <ul>
455    *    <li>If element type was specified (via {@link #create(Class)}), the converted element must be an instance of that type
456    *    <li>If {@link #create()} was used (no types specified), <c>Object.class</c> is used, which accepts any type
457    * </ul>
458    *
459    * <h5 class='section'>Return Value:</h5>
460    * <ul>
461    *    <li>If the element is added successfully, returns <jk>true</jk>
462    *    <li>If the element is filtered out or already present, returns <jk>false</jk>
463    * </ul>
464    *
465    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
466    * <p class='bjava'>
467    *    FilteredSet&lt;Integer&gt; <jv>set</jv> = FilteredSet
468    *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
469    *       .filter(v -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
470    *       .elementFunction(o -&gt; Integer.parseInt(o.toString()))
471    *       .build();
472    *
473    *    <jv>set</jv>.addConverted(<js>"123"</js>);  <jc>// Element converted from String to Integer</jc>
474    * </p>
475    *
476    * @param element The element to add. Will be converted if an element function is configured.
477    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the element was added, <jk>false</jk> if it was filtered out or already present.
478    * @throws RuntimeException If conversion fails or type validation fails.
479    */
480   public boolean addConverted(Object element) {
481      E convertedElement = convertElement(element);
482      return add(convertedElement);
483   }
484
485   /**
486    * Adds all elements from the specified collection with automatic type conversion.
487    *
488    * <p>
489    * This method iterates over all elements in the source collection and adds each one using {@link #addConverted(Object)},
490    * which applies conversion and validation before adding.
491    *
492    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
493    * <p class='bjava'>
494    *    FilteredSet&lt;Integer&gt; <jv>set</jv> = FilteredSet
495    *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
496    *       .filter(v -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
497    *       .elementFunction(o -&gt; Integer.parseInt(o.toString()))
498    *       .build();
499    *
500    *    Collection&lt;String&gt; <jv>source</jv> = List.of(<js>"5"</js>, <js>"-1"</js>);
501    *    <jv>set</jv>.addAllConverted(<jv>source</jv>);  <jc>// Elements converted, negative value filtered out</jc>
502    * </p>
503    *
504    * @param source The collection containing elements to add. Can be <jk>null</jk> (no-op).
505    * @return This object for method chaining.
506    */
507   public FilteredSet<E> addAllConverted(Collection<?> source) {
508      if (source != null) {
509         for (var e : source) {
510            addConverted(e);
511         }
512      }
513      return this;
514   }
515
516   /**
517    * Adds arbitrary values to this set.
518    *
519    * <p>
520    * Objects can be any of the following:
521    * <ul>
522    *    <li>The same type or convertible to the element type of this set.
523    *    <li>Collections or arrays of anything on this set.
524    * </ul>
525    *
526    * <p>
527    * Each element from the collections/arrays will be added using {@link #add(Object)}, which applies
528    * conversion and filtering.
529    *
530    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
531    * <p class='bjava'>
532    *    FilteredSet&lt;Integer&gt; <jv>set</jv> = FilteredSet
533    *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(Integer.<jk>class</jk>)
534    *       .filter(v -&gt; v != <jk>null</jk> &amp;&amp; v &gt; 0)
535    *       .build();
536    *
537    *    Set&lt;Integer&gt; <jv>set1</jv> = Set.of(5, -1);
538    *    Set&lt;Integer&gt; <jv>set2</jv> = Set.of(10);
539    *    <jv>set</jv>.addAny(<jv>set1</jv>, <jv>set2</jv>);  <jc>// Adds 5, 10 (-1 filtered out)</jc>
540    * </p>
541    *
542    * @param values The values to add. Can be <jk>null</jk> or contain <jk>null</jk> values (ignored).
543    * @return This object for method chaining.
544    */
545   public FilteredSet<E> addAny(Object...values) {
546      if (values != null) {
547         for (var o : values) {
548            if (o == null)
549               continue;
550            if (o instanceof Collection<?> c) {
551               addAllConverted(c);
552            } else if (o.getClass().isArray()) {
553               for (int i = 0; i < java.lang.reflect.Array.getLength(o); i++) {
554                  addConverted(java.lang.reflect.Array.get(o, i));
555               }
556            } else {
557               addConverted(o);
558            }
559         }
560      }
561      return this;
562   }
563
564   private E convertElement(Object element) {
565      if (elementFunction != null) {
566         element = elementFunction.apply(element);
567      }
568      if (element == null) {
569         // Allow null for non-primitive types
570         if (elementType.isPrimitive())
571            throw rex("Cannot set null element for primitive type {0}", elementType.getName());
572         return null;
573      }
574      if (elementType.isInstance(element))
575         return elementType.cast(element);
576      throw rex("Object of type {0} could not be converted to element type {1}", cn(element), cn(elementType));
577   }
578
579   @Override
580   public String toString() {
581      return set.toString();
582   }
583
584   @Override
585   public boolean equals(Object o) {
586      return set.equals(o);
587   }
588
589   @Override
590   public int hashCode() {
591      return set.hashCode();
592   }
593}
594
